cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem
Interface OperationIterator

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Operation>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BucketIterator, JobShopIterator, KnapsackIterator, SATIterator, TSPInvertingIterator, TSPIterator
public interface OperationIterator
extends java.util.Iterator<Operation>

Lazy iterator over operations in problem.

Goal of OperationIterator is to be able to reduce the overhead of creating list of all operation for a configuration, when only few will be used in near future. Instead, OperationIterator creates operation only when they are necessary, thus greatly reducing memory overhead.

Method Summary
 Operation getRandomOperation()
          Returns randomly chosen operation.
 boolean hasNext()
          Checks if there is more operations left in iterator.
 Operation next()
          Fetches next operation from iterator and increases internal counter.
 void remove()
          Removes last operation returned by next() (optional).
 

Method Detail

getRandomOperation

Operation getRandomOperation()
                             throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Returns randomly chosen operation.

Note that internal counter is not changed, therefore subsequent calls to next will be unaffected by getRandomOperation.

Also, two calls of getRandomOperation could possibly return the same operation.

Returns:
randomly chosen operation
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if random operation is not supported

boolean hasNext()
Checks if there is more operations left in iterator.

Specified by:

Returns:
true if there is at least one more operation left

next

Fetches next operation from iterator and increases internal counter.

Specified by:

remove

void remove()
Removes last operation returned by next() (optional).

Optional, usually not implemented.

Specified by:
